name: py-pennylane

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description: PennyLane is a Python quantum machine learning library by Xanadu Inc.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description:
NumPy is the fundamental package for scientific computing with Python.
It contains among other things: a powerful N-dimensional array object,
sophisticated (broadcasting) functions, tools for integrating C/C++ and
Fortran code, and useful linear algebra, Fourier transform, and random
number capabilities

dependencies.name: py-scipy
dependencies.description:
SciPy (pronounced "Sigh Pie") is a Scientific Library for Python. It
provides many user-friendly and efficient numerical routines such as
routines for numerical integration and optimization.

dependencies.name: py-networkx
dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependencies.name: py-retworkx
dependencies.description: A high performance Python graph library implemented in Rust.

dependencies.name: py-autograd
dependencies.description:
Autograd can automatically differentiate native Python and Numpy code.
It can handle a large subset of Python's features, including loops, ifs,
recursion and closures, and it can even take derivatives of derivatives
of derivatives. It supports reverse-mode differentiation (a.k.a.
backpropagation), which means it can efficiently take gradients of
scalar-valued functions with respect to array-valued arguments, as well
as forward-mode differentiation, and the two can be composed
arbitrarily. The main intended application of Autograd is gradient-based
optimization. For more information, check out the tutorial and the
examples directory.

dependencies.name: py-toml
dependencies.description:
A Python library for parsing and creating TOML configuration files. For
more information on the TOML standard, see https://github.com/toml-
lang/toml.git

dependencies.name: py-appdirs
dependencies.description:
A small Python module for determining appropriate platform-specific
dirs, e.g. a "user data dir".

dependencies.name: py-semantic-version
dependencies.description:
This small python library provides a few tools to handle SemVer in
Python. It follows strictly the 2.0.0 version of the SemVer scheme.

dependencies.name: py-autoray
dependencies.description:
Write backend agnostic numeric code compatible with any numpy-ish array
library.

dependencies.name: py-cachetools
dependencies.description:
This module provides various memoizing collections and decorators,
including variants of the Python 3 Standard Library @lru_cache function
decorator.
